Class Decoder

java.lang.Object
ie.atu.sw.Decoder
public class Decoder extends Object
decoder takes in a list of numbers and turns them back into words or suffixes this is the reverse of what encoder does we use the decoding map to look everything up Big-O: O(n) for decodeLine where n is amount of codes in a line
See Also:
  • Encoder

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Decoder(Map<Integer,String> decodingMap)
    sets the decoding map we gonna use to turn codes into words good for decodeLine and decodeFile

    decodeLine(List<Integer> codes)
    this method takes a list of numbers and tries to turn them into words if a number isn't in the map we just throw in [???] instead

  • Method Details

    • decodeLine

      public String decodeLine(List<Integer> codes)
      this method takes a list of numbers and tries to turn them into words if a number isn't in the map we just throw in [???] instead
      Parameters:
      codes - list of integers from the encoded file
      Returns:
      a string with the decoded sentence Big-O: O(n) where n = amount of codes in the line

    • decodeFile

      public List<String> decodeFile(List<String> encodedLines)
      takes a list of lines from an encoded file and decodes them all each line has space separated codes uses decodeLine for each line
      Parameters:
      encodedLines - lines from a file where each number is a code
      Returns:
      decoded lines as readable sentences
      See Also:
      • decodeLine(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>)
